 19536                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19537                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19538                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19539                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19540                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19541                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19542                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19543                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19544                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19545                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19546                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19547                                  ;
 19548                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19549                                  
 19550                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19551                                  update_arena:
 19552 00000977 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19553 00000978 57                      	push	di
 19554 00000979 51                      	push	cx
 19555 0000097A 52                      	push	dx
 19556                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19557                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19558                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19559                                  	; ds = cs 
 19560 0000097B C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19561 0000097F 4F                      	dec	di
 19562 00000980 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19563                                  						;  before sysvar
 19564 00000981 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19565                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19566 00000983 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19567 00000988 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19568 0000098A 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19569                                  
 19570                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19571 0000098C 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19572 00000991 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19573 00000993 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19574 00000995 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19575 00000997 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19576                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19577 00000999 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19578                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19579 0000099D C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19580 000009A3 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19581                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19582 000009A5 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19583 000009A9 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19584                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19585                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19586 000009AB 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19587 000009AE 5A                      	pop	dx
 19588 000009AF 59                      	pop	cx
 19589 000009B0 5F                      	pop	di
 19590 000009B1 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19591 000009B2 C3                      	retn
 19592                                  ;
 19593                                  ; M012 : END
 19594                                  ;

 19613                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19614                                  ;
 19615                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19616                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19617                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19618                                  ;
 19619                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19620                                  ;
 19621                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19622                                  
 19623                                  AllocHMA:
 19624                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19625                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19626                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19627                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19628                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.

 19635                                  ;	popf

 19781                                  
 19782                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19783                                  ;
 19784                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19785                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19786                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19787                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19788                                  ;
 19789                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19790                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19791                                  ;
 19792                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19793                                  
 19794                                  StartVDHead:
 19795                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19796                                  
 19797 00000A36 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19798 00000A3A 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19799 00000A3C 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19800 00000A3E 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19801 00000A40 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19802                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19803 00000A41 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19804                                  VDiskSig1:
 19805 00000A48 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19806                                  
 19807                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19808                                  
 19809 00000A4D 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19810                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19811 00000A53 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19812 00000A62 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19813 00000A64 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19814                                  VDInt19:
 19815 00000A65 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19816                                  OldVDInt19:
 19817 00000A66 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19818                                  
 19819                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19820                                  
 19821                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19822 00000A6A 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19823                                  VDiskSig2:
 19824 00000A6D 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19825                                  
 19826                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19827                                  
 19828 00000A72 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19829 00000A75 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19830 00000A77 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19831 00000A78 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19832 00000A7A 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19833 00000A7B 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19834 00000A7D 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19835 00000A7F FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19836 00000A80 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19837 00000A82 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19838 00000A84 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19839 00000A86 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19840 00000A88 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19841                                  
 19842                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19843                                  
 19844                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19845                                  ;
 19846                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19847                                  ;
 19848                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19849                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19850                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19851                                  ;
 19852                                  ; Inputs : None
 19853                                  ;
 19854                                  ; Outputs : None
 19855                                  ;
 19856                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19857                                  ;
 19858                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19859                                  
 19860                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19861                                  
 19862                                  InstVDiskHeader:

 19864 00000A8C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19865                                  
 19866                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19867                                  
 19868                                  	; 23/10/2022

 19870                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19871 00000A91 2EA3[660A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19872 00000A95 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19873                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19874 00000A98 2EA3[680A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19875                                  
 19876                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19877                                  
 19878 00000A9C B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19879                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19880                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19881 00000A9E BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19882 00000AA1 CD21                    	int	21h
 19883                                  
 19884                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19885                                  
 19886 00000AA3 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19887 00000AA4 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19888                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19889 00000AA6 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19890                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19891 00000AAD 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19892 00000AB4 40                      	inc	ax
 19893 00000AB5 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19894                                  
 19895                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19896                                  
 19897 00000AB7 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 19898                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 19899 00000AB8 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 19900 00000ABE A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 19901                                  
 19902                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 19903                                  
 19904                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 19905 00000AC1 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 19906 00000AC4 BE[360A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 19907 00000AC7 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 19908 00000AC9 0E                      	push	cs
 19909 00000ACA 1F                      	pop	ds
 19910 00000ACB FC                      	cld
 19911 00000ACC F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 19912 00000ACE FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?

 19934                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 19935                                  ;
 19936                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary

 19938                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session

 19944 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 19945 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address

 19947 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;

 19974 00000B14 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)

 19976                                  
 19977                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIt1.ASM)
 19978                                  
 19979                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 19980                                  
 19981                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19982                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19983                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19984                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19985                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19986                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19987                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19988                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19989                                  ;								      ;I070
 19990                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19991                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19992                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19993                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19994                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19995                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19996                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19997                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19998                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19999                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20000                                  ;								      ;I070
 20001                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20002                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20003                                  
 20004                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20005                                  	; ds = cs
 20006                                  
 20007 00000B34 06                      	push	es
 20008 00000B35 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20009 00000B37 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20010 00000B39 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20011 00000B3B D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20012 00000B3D B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20013 00000B3F D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20014 00000B41 05[140B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20015 00000B44 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20016                                  
 20017                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20018                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20019                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 20020                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20021                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 20022                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20023                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20024 00000B47 A3[F60A]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 20025                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20026 00000B4A 8816[F80A]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 20027                                  
 20028 00000B4E B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 20029 00000B51 0E                      	push	cs
 20030 00000B52 07                      	pop	es
 20031 00000B53 BE[E40A]                	mov	si,bmove
 20032 00000B56 B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 20033 00000B58 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 20034                                  			; CX = number of words to move

 20036                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status

 20040                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20041                                  ;
 20042                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20043                                  ;
 20044                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20045                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20046                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20047                                  ;		the offset.
 20048                                  ;
 20049                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 20050                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 20051                                  ;
 20052                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20053                                  
 20054                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 20055 00000B5C 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 20056 00000B5E B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh		; HMA segment
 20057 00000B61 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20058 00000B63 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 20059 00000B66 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20060 00000B69 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20061 00000B6B D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20062 00000B6D 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20063 00000B6F 1E                      	push	ds
 20064                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20065                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 20066                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20067 00000B70 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20068 00000B73 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20069 00000B75 893E[F508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20070 00000B79 C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20071 00000B7E 1F                      	pop	ds
 20072 00000B7F C3                      	retn

 20074                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20075                                  ;
 20076                                  ; procedure : IsVDiskInstalled
 20077                                  ;
 20078                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary
 20079                                  ;		& INT 19 vector
 20080                                  ;
 20081                                  ; Inputs  : A20 flag should be ON
 20082                                  ; Outputs : Zero set if VDISK header found else Zero cleared

 20096 00000B8F 07                      	pop	es
 20097 00000B90 BF[480A]                	mov	di,VDiskSig1
 20098 00000B93 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 20099 00000B95 7410                    	je	short ivdins_retn
 20100 00000B97 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20101 00000B9A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20102                                  	;mov	si,10h+(VDiskSig2-VDiskHMAHead) ; 13h
 20103 00000B9C BE1300                  	mov	si,13h

 20105                                  	;mov	cx,VLEN2  ; 5
 20106 00000BA2 B90500                  	mov	cx,5
 20107 00000BA5 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb

 20109 00000BA7 C3                      	retn			; returns the Zero flag

 20113                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20114                                  ;
 20115                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20116                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20117                                  ;
 20118                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20119                                  
 20120                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20121                                  CPMHack:
 20122 00000BA8 1E                      	push	ds
 20123 00000BA9 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20124 00000BAC 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20125                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20126                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20127 00000BAE 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20128 00000BAF 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20129 00000BB1 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20130 00000BB4 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20131                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20132 00000BB7 B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20133 00000BB9 FC                      	cld
 20134 00000BBA F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20135 00000BBC 1F                      	pop	ds
 20136 00000BBD C3                      	retn

 20232                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.

 20741                                  ;*******************************************************************************
 20742                                  ;									       *
 20743                                  ; function: actually allocate buffers in the memory and initialize it. 	       *
 20744                                  ; input :								       *
 20745                                  ;    memhi:memlo - start of the next available memory			       *
 20746                                  ;    buffers = number of buffers					       *
 20747                                  ;    h_buffers = number of secondary buffers				       *
 20748                                  ;									       *
 20749                                  ; output:								       *
 20750                                  ;	buffinfo.cache_count - # of caches to be installed.		       *
 20751                                  ;	buffinfo set.							       *
 20752                                  ;	bufferqueue set.						       *
 20753                                  ;									       *
 20754                                  ; subroutines to be called:						       *
 20755                                  ;									       *
 20756                                  ;*******************************************************************************
 20757

 21002                                  
 21003                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21004                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21005                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21006                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21007                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21008                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21009                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21010                                  ;
 21011                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21012                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21013                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21014                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21015                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21016                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21017                                  ;
 21018                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21019                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21020                                  ;
 21021                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21022                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21023                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21024                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21025                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21026                                  ;
 21027                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21028                                  ;
 21029                                  ;			  none.
 21030                                  
 21031                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21032                                  ;
 21033                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21034                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21035                                  
 21036                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21037                                  
 21038 00000F49 50                      	push	ax
 21039 00000F4A 53                      	push	bx
 21040 00000F4B 52                      	push	dx
 21041 00000F4C 06                      	push	es
 21042                                  
 21043 00000F4D B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;reset h/w by writing to port
 21044 00000F4F BAF202                  	mov	dx,2F2h 		;get starting address
 21045 00000F52 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f2h,0ffh
 21046 00000F53 42                      	inc	dx
 21047 00000F54 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f3h,0ffh
 21048 00000F55 42                      	inc	dx
 21049 00000F56 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f4h,0ffh
 21050 00000F57 42                      	inc	dx
 21051 00000F58 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f5h,0ffh
 21052 00000F59 42                      	inc	dx

 21054 00000F5B 42                      	inc	dx

 21080 00000F7E EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f3h,0ffh
 21081 00000F7F 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 21082 00000F80 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f4h,0ffh
 21083 00000F81 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address

 21241                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21242                                  ;
 21243                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21244                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21245                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21246                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21247                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21248                                  ; program).
 21249                                  
 21250                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21251                                  
 21252                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21253                                  
 21254 00001031 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21255                                  
 21256                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21257                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21258                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21259                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21260                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21261                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21262                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21263                                  ; carridge return.
 21264                                  
 21265                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21266                                  ;character after =.
 21267                                  
 21268 00001032 06                      	push	es
 21269 00001033 1E                      	push	ds
 21270 00001034 07                      	pop	es
 21271 00001035 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21272 00001036 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21273                                  
 21274 00001038 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21275 0000103A FC                      	cld
 21276 0000103B 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21277 00001041 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21278                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21279 00001044 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21280 00001045 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21281                                  	;je	short got_installparm
 21282                                  	;jmp	short installfilename
 21283                                  	; 10/04/2024
 21284 00001047 75FB                    	jne	short installfilename
 21285                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21286 00001049 AC                      	lodsb
 21287 0000104A 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21288 0000104D 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21289 0000104F 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21290 00001051 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21291 00001053 47                      	inc	di
 21292 00001054 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21293                                  done_installparm:
 21294 00001056 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21295 0000105B 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21296 0000105E 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 21297 00001060 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 21298                                  					; starts with cr.
 21299                                  install_seg_set:
 21300 00001066 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 21301 0000106D 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 21302                                  
 21303                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 21304                                  ;
 21305                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 21306                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 21307                                  ;
 21308                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 21309                                  ;
 21310                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 21311                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 21312                                  ; 	was fixed. 
 21313                                  ;
 21314                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21315                                  
 21316                                  ;;ifdef   MULTI_CONFIG
 21317                                  
 21318                                  ; If there's any environment data in "config_wrkseg", pass to app
 21319                                  
 21320                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 21321                                          ;mov     cx,ax
 21322                                          ;cmp     word [cs:config_envlen],0
 21323                                          ;je      short no_envdata2
 21324                                          ;mov     cx,[cs:config_wrkseg]
 21325                                  ;no_envdata2:
 21326                                  ;;endif  ;MULTI_CONFIG
 21327                                  
 21328                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_environ],cx ; set the environment seg.
 21329                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21330                                  	;mov	[cs:iexec.environ],cx
 21331                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21332 0000106F 2EA3[BE03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.environ],ax	
 21333                                  
 21334                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 21335 00001073 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 21336                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21337 00001077 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21338                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21339 0000107B 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21340 0000107F E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 21341 00001082 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 21342 00001086 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21343 00001088 B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 21344 0000108A BB[BE03]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 21345 0000108D 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 21346 0000108E 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 21347 0000108F 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 21348                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 21349                                  
 21350                                  ;----------------------------------------
 21351                                  
 21352                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 21353                                  
 21354                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 21355                                  
 21356                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 21357 00001094 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 21358 00001095 06                      	push	es
 21359 00001096 1E                      	push	ds
 21360 00001097 07                      	pop	es
 21361 00001098 1F                      	pop	ds			; now ds - sysinitseg, es - confbot
 21362 00001099 7306                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 21363                                  
 21364 0000109B 56                      	push	si			; error in loading the file for install=.
 21365 0000109C E8AA22                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 21366 0000109F 5E                      	pop	si
 21367                                  
 21368                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21369                                  	;jmp	short sysinitptr_retn ; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1140h)
 21370                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21371                                  	; ds = cs
 21372 000010A0 C3                      	retn
 21373                                  
 21374                                  install_exit_ret:
 21375                                  	;retn		; retn (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1283h) ; 18/12/2022
 21376                                  
 21377                                  	; 24/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 21378                                  ;SYSINIT:1142h:
 21379 000010A1 B44D                    	mov     ah,4Dh
 21380 000010A3 CD21                    	int     21h             ; DOS - 2+ - GET EXIT CODE OF SUBPROGRAM (WAIT)
 21381 000010A5 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3
 21382 000010A8 7404                    	jz      short sysinitptr_retn
 21383 000010AA E88F16                  	call    error_line
 21384 000010AD F9                      	stc
 21385                                  sysinitptr_retn:	; (SYSINIT:114Fh)
 21386 000010AE C3                      	retn		
 21387                                  
 21388                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21389                                  
 21390                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21391                                  ;
 21392                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21393                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21394                                  ;
 21395                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21396                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21397                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21398                                  
 21399                                  ParaRound:
 21400 000010AF 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21401 000010B2 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21402 000010B4 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21403 000010B6 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21404 000010B8 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21405 000010BA C3                      	retn
 21406                                  
 21407                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21408                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21409                                  ;
 21410                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21411                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21412                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21413                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21414                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21415                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21416                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21417                                  ;
 21418                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21419                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21420                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21421                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21422                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21423                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21424                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21425                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21426                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21427                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21428                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21429                                  ;
 21430                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21431                                  
 21432                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21433                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21434                                  sysinit_base:				
 21435 000010BB 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21436 000010C0 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21437 000010C5 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21438 000010C7 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21439 000010CC 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21440 000010D1 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21441 000010D2 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21442 000010D3 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21443                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21444                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21445 000010D5 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21446 000010D8 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21447 000010DD 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21448                                  
 21449                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21450                                  
 21451 000010DF B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21452 000010E1 0E                      	push	cs
 21453 000010E2 1F                      	pop	ds
 21454 000010E3 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21455 000010E6 CD21                    	int	21h
 21456                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21457                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21458                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21459                                  _stall: 
 21460                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21461 000010E8 F4                      	hlt 
 21462                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21463                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21464 000010E9 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21465                                  
 21466                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21467 000010EB 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21468                                  
 21469                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21470                                  
 21471                                  sum_up:
 21472                                  
 21473                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21474                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21475                                  ;
 21476                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21477                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21478                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21479                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21480                                  ;
 21481                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21482                                  
 21483 000010F0 1E                      	push	ds
 21484                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21485                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21486 000010F1 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21487 000010F5 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21488 000010F7 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21489 000010F9 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21490 000010FB 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21491                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21492 00001100 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21493 00001102 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21494                                  sum1:
 21495 00001104 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21496 00001106 46                      	inc	si
 21497 00001107 46                      	inc	si
 21498 00001108 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21499                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21500                                  sum_sys_code:
 21501                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21502 0000110A BE0A11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21503                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21504                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21505                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21506                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21507                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21508                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21509                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21510 0000110D B9[5039]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21511 00001110 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21512 00001112 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21513                                  sum2:
 21514 00001114 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21515 00001117 46                      	inc	si
 21516 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 21517 00001119 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21518 0000111B 1F                      	pop	ds
 21519 0000111C C3                      	retn
 21520                                  
 21521                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21522                                  
 21523                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21524                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21525 0000111D 0000                    	dw	0
 21526                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21527                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 21528 0000111F 0000                    	dw	0
 21529                                  
 21530                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 21531                                  
 21532                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 21533                                  
 21534                                  ;SYSINIT:12F6h:	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21535 00001121 0D0A                    	db	0Dh,0Ah
 21536 00001123 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'
 21536 0000112C 6C6F636174696F6E20-
 21536 00001135 6572726F722024     
 21537                                  
 21538                                  end_sysinit_base: ; label byte
 21539                                  	; 24/10/2022

 21542                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21543                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21544                                  ;
 21545                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21546                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21547                                  ;
 21548                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21549                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21550                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21551                                  ;
 21552                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21553                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21554                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21555                                  
 21556                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21557                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 21558                                  
 21559                                  set_buffer:
 21560 0000113C 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21561 0000113E E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21562 00001141 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 21563 00001143 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 21564                                  set_buff_1:
 21565                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21566                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 21567 00001145 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 21568                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 21569 00001147 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 21570                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 21571 0000114A C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21572                                  
 21573 0000114F 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21574 00001151 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21575 00001156 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21576                                  
 21577                                  ;	for each buffer
 21578                                  
 21579                                  nxt_buff:
 21580 00001157 E86300                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 21581 0000115A 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 21582 0000115C E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 21583                                  
 21584 0000115E 2E2B3E[9B02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 21585                                  
 21586 00001163 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 21587                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 21588 00001164 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 21589 00001167 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 21590                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21591                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21592 00001169 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 21593                                  
 21594 0000116D 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 21595 0000116F 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 21596                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 21597 00001171 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21598 00001175 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21599                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 21600 00001179 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 21601                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 21602 0000117E 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 21603 00001181 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 21604                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 21605 00001185 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21606                                  set_buff_2:
 21607 00001188 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 21608                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 21609 0000118D 2E800E[2414]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 21610                                  	;call	round
 21611                                  	;retn
 21612                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21613 00001193 E91C1F                  	jmp	round

 21615                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21616                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21617                                  ;
 21618                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21619                                  ;
 21620                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21621                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21622                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21623                                  
 21624                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21625                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21626 00001196 53                      	push	bx
 21627 00001197 52                      	push	dx
 21628 00001198 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21629 0000119C 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21630                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21631 000011A1 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21632                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21633                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21634                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21635 000011A4 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21636 000011A6 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21637 000011A8 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21638                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21639 000011AB CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21640 000011AD 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21641 000011B0 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21642 000011B2 BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21643                                  	;zf=1
 21644                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21645                                  	;zf=1
 21646 000011B5 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21647                                  got_hma:
 21648 000011BA 5A                      	pop	dx
 21649 000011BB 5B                      	pop	bx
 21650 000011BC C3                      	retn
 21651                                  
 21652                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21653                                  
 21654                                  set_buffer_info:
 21655                                  
 21656                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 21657                                  ;
 21658                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 21659                                  ;    ax = di
 21660                                  ;
 21661                                  ;out:
 21662                                  ;    above entries set.
 21663                                  
 21664                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21665 000011BD 2EFF36[3903]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 21666                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 21667 000011C2 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 21668 000011C6 2EA3[3903]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 21669 000011CA 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 21670                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 21671 000011CF 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 21672                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 21673 000011D2 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 21674                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21675 000011D8 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 21676                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21677 000011DE 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 21678 000011E4 C3                      	retn

 21684                                  
 21685                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21686                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21687                                  ;
 21688                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21689                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21690                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21691                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21692                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21693                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21694                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21695                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21696                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21697                                  ;
 21698                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21699                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21700                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21701                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21702                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21703                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21704                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21705                                  ;	conditions:
 21706                                  ;
 21707                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21708                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21709                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21710                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21711                                  ;
 21712                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21713                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21714                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21715                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21716                                  ;
 21717                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21718                                  ;
 21719                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21720                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21721                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21722                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21723                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21724                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21725                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21726                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21727                                  ;
 21728                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21729                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21730                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21731                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21732                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21733                                  ;
 21734                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21735                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21736                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21737                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21738                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21739                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21740                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21741                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21742                                  ;
 21743                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21744                                  
 21745                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21746                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21747                                  
 21748                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21749                                  stackinit:
 21750 000011E5 50                      	push	ax
 21751 000011E6 1E                      	push	ds
 21752 000011E7 06                      	push	es
 21753 000011E8 53                      	push	bx
 21754 000011E9 51                      	push	cx
 21755 000011EA 52                      	push	dx
 21756 000011EB 57                      	push	di
 21757 000011EC 56                      	push	si
 21758 000011ED 55                      	push	bp
 21759                                  
 21760                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21761                                  
 21762                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21763                                  	; ds = cs
 21764 000011EE A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21765 000011F1 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21766                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21767                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21768                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21769 000011F3 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21770                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21771 000011F7 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21772 000011FA 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21773                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21774 000011FE A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21775                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21776                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21777                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21778 00001201 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21779                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21780 00001205 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21781 00001207 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21782                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21783                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21784                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21785 0000120A 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21786                                  
 21787                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21788                                  
 21789                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21790                                  
 21791                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21792                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21793                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 21794 0000120E 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 21795                                  
 21796                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 21797                                  
 21798 00001213 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 21799                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 21800                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21801                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 21802 00001216 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21803 00001218 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21804 0000121A 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 21805 0000121E 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21806 00001220 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 21807                                  
 21808                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 21809                                  
 21810 00001223 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 21811 00001228 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 21812 0000122C F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21813 0000122E 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21814 00001230 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21815 00001232 06                      	push	es
 21816 00001233 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 21817                                  
 21818                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 21819                                  
 21820 00001234 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 21821 00001238 FC                      	cld
 21822 00001239 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 21823                                  
 21824 0000123B 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21825                                  
 21826                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21827                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21828                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 21829                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 21830                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 21831                                  
 21832                                  buildloop:
 21833                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21834                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 21835                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21836 0000123F 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free
 21837 00001244 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 21838                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 21839 00001248 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax
 21840                                  	;mov	[es:bp2],ax
 21841 0000124C 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 21842                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 21843 00001250 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]
 21844 00001254 26895E06                	mov	[es:bp+newsp],bx		; mov [es:bp+6],bx
 21845                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx
 21846 00001258 26892F                  	mov	[es:bx],bp
 21847 0000125B 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 21848                                  
 21849 0000125E E2DF                    	loop	buildloop
 21850                                  
 21851 00001260 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8
 21852 00001263 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp
 21853 00001267 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp
 21854                                  
 21855 0000126B 1E                      	push	ds
 21856 0000126C B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 21857 0000126F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21858 00001271 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ;convertible?
 21859 00001276 1F                      	pop	ds
 21860 00001277 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 21861                                  
 21862 00001279 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable convertible nmis
 21863 0000127B E672                    	out	72h,al
 21864                                  
 21865                                  skip_disablenmis:
 21866 0000127D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21867 0000127F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			;es - segid of vector table at 0
 21868                                  					;ds - relocated stack code segment
 21869 00001281 FA                      	cli
 21870                                  
 21871                                  	;irp	aa,<02,08,09,70>
 21872                                  	;
 21873                                  	;mov	si,aa&h*4		;pass where vector is to be adjusted
 21874                                  	;mov	di,offset int19old&aa	;we have to set old&aa for int19 handler too.
 21875                                  	;mov	bx,offset old&aa	;pass where to save original owner pointer
 21876                                  	;mov	dx,offset int&aa	;pass where new handler is
 21877                                  	;call	new_init_loop		;adjust the vector to new handler,
 21878                                  	;				;saving pointer to original owner
 21879                                  	;endm
 21880                                  
 21881                                  stkinit_02:
 21882 00001282 BE0800                  	mov	si,02h*4 ; 8
 21883 00001285 BF[4206]                	mov	di,INT19OLD02
 21884 00001288 BB[1200]                	mov	bx,old02
 21885 0000128B BA[1600]                	mov	dx,int02
 21886 0000128E E84901                  	call	new_init_loop
 21887                                  stkinit_08:
 21888 00001291 BE2000                  	mov	si,08h*4 ; 32
 21889 00001294 BF[4706]                	mov	di,INT19OLD08
 21890 00001297 BB[3800]                	mov	bx,old08
 21891 0000129A BA[3C00]                	mov	dx,int08
 21892 0000129D E83A01                  	call	new_init_loop
 21893                                  stkinit_09:
 21894 000012A0 BE2400                  	mov	si,09h*4 ; 36
 21895 000012A3 BF[4C06]                	mov	di,INT19OLD09
 21896 000012A6 BB[4100]                	mov	bx,old09
 21897 000012A9 BA[4500]                	mov	dx,int09
 21898 000012AC E82B01                  	call	new_init_loop
 21899                                  stkinit_70:
 21900 000012AF BEC001                  	mov	si,70h*4 ; 448
 21901 000012B2 BF[6A06]                	mov	di,INT19OLD70
 21902 000012B5 BB[4E00]                	mov	bx,old70
 21903 000012B8 BA[5200]                	mov	dx,int70
 21904 000012BB E81C01                  	call	new_init_loop
 21905                                  
 21906                                  	;irp	aa,<0a,0b,0c,0d,0e,72,73,74,76,77> ;shared interrupts
 21907                                  	;
 21908                                  	;mov	si,aa&h*4		;pass where vector is to be adjusted
 21909                                  	;push	ds			;save relocated stack code segment
 21910                                  	;lds	bx, es:[si]		;ds:bx -> original interrupt handler
 21911                                  	;push	ds
 21912                                  	;pop	dx			;dx = segment value
 21913                                  	;	
 21914                                  	;cmp	dx,0
 21915                                  	;jz	int&aa&_first
 21916                                  	;
 21917                                  	;cmp	byte ptr ds:[bx],0cfh	;does vector point to an iret?
 21918                                  	;jz	int&aa&_first
 21919                                  	;

 21921                                  	;jz	int&aa&_not_first
 21922                                  	;
 21923                                  	;cmp	dx,0f000h		;rom bios segment
 21924                                  	;jnz	int&aa&_not_first
 21925                                  	;
 21926                                  	;push	es
 21927                                  	;push	dx
 21928                                  	;mov	dx,0f000h
 21929                                  	;mov	es,dx
 21930                                  	;cmp	bx,word ptr es:0ff01h
 21931                                         	;pop	dx
 21932                                  	;pop	es
 21933                                  	;jz	int&aa&_first
 21934                                  	;
 21935                                  ;int&aa&_not_first:			;not the first. we are going to hook vector.
 21936                                  	;pop	ds
 21937                                  	;mov	di, offset int19old&aa	;we have to set old&aa for int19 handler too.
 21938                                  	;mov	bx, offset old&aa	;pass where to save original owner pointer
 21939                                  	;mov	dx, offset int&aa	;pass where new handler is
 21940                                  	;call	new_init_loop		;adjust the vector to new handler, saving
 21941                                  	;				;pointer to original owner.
 21942                                  	;jmp	short int&aa&_end
 21943                                  ;int&aa&_first:				;the first. don't have to hook stack code.
 21944                                  	;pop	ds
 21945                                  ;int&aa&_end:
 21946                                  	;
 21947                                  	;endm
