 22580                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22581                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22582                                  
 22583                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22584                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22585                                  
 22586                                  new_init_loop:
 22587                                  
 22588                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22589                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22590                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22591                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22592                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22593                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22594                                  
 22595 000013DA 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22596 000013DD 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22597 000013DF 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22598 000013E3 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22599                                  
 22600 000013E6 1E                      	push	ds
 22601                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22602                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22603                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22604 000013E7 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22605 000013EA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22606 000013EC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22607 000013EF 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22608 000013F1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22609 000013F5 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22610 000013F8 1F                      	pop	ds
 22611                                  
 22612 000013F9 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22613 000013FC 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22614 00001400 C3                      	retn
 22615                                  
 22616                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22617                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22618                                  
 22619                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22620                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22621                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22622                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22623                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22624                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22625                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22626                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22627                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22628                                  
 22629                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22630                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22631                                  
 22632                                  setdevmark:
 22633                                  
 22634 00001401 06                      	push	es
 22635 00001402 51                      	push	cx
 22636                                  
 22637 00001403 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22638 00001408 2E890E[2214]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22639 0000140D 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22640                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22641                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22642 0000140F 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22643 00001413 41                      	inc	cx
 22644                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22645 00001414 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22646                                  
 22647 00001419 59                      	pop	cx
 22648 0000141A 07                      	pop	es
 22649 0000141B 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22650 00001420 C3                      	retn
 22651

 22850                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22851                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22852                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22853                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22854                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22855                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22856                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22857                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22858                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22859                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22860                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22861                                  
 22862                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22863                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22864 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX

 22875                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE

 22887                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22888                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22889 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22890 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22891 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22892                                  endstruc
 22893                                  
 22894                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22895                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22896                                  ;
 22897                                  ;
 22898                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22899                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22900                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22901                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22902                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22903                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22904                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22905                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22906                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22907                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22908                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22909                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22910                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22911                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22912                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22913                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22914                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22915                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22916                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22917                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22918                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22919                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22920                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22921                                  ;	   :
 22922                                  ;
 22923                                  ;Note:
 22924                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22925                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22926                                  ;
 22927                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22928                                  ;
 22929                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22930                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22931                                  ;
 22932                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22933                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22934                                  ;
 22935                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22936                                  ;
 22937                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22938                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22939                                  ;
 22940                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22941                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22942                                  ;
 22943                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22944                                  ;
 22945                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22946                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22947                                  ;
 22948                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22949                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22950                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22951                                  ;
 22952                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22953                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22954                                  ;
 22955                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22956                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22957                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22958                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22959                                  
 22960                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22961                                  
 22962                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22963                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22964                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22965                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22966                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22967                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22968                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22969                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22970                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22971                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22972                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22973                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22974                                  
 22975                                  ;**** Function flags
 22976                                  
 22977                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22978                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22979                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22980                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22981                                  
 22982                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22983                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22984 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22985 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22986 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22987 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22988 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22989 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22990                                  endstruc
 22991                                  
 22992                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22993                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22994                                  ;
 22995                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22996                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22997                                  ;	     +-
 22998                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22999                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23000                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23001                                  ;	     |	:
 23002                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23003                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23004                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23005                                  ;	     |	:
 23006                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23007                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23008                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23009                                  ;	     +-	:
 23010                                  ;
 23011                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23012                                  ;
 23013                                  ;Note:
 23014                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23015                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23016                                  ;
 23017                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23018                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23019                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23020                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23021                                  
 23022                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23023                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23024                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23025                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23026                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23027                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23028                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23029                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23030                                  
 23031                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23032 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23033 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23034 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23035 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23036 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23037                                  endstruc
 23038                                  
 23039                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23040                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23041                                  ;
 23042                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23043                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23044                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23045                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23046                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23047                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23048                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23049                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23050                                  ;
 23051                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23052                                  ;
 23053                                  ;            +-
 23054                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23055                                  ;	    | or
 23056                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23057                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23058                                  ;	    | or
 23059                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23060                                  ;	    | or
 23061                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23062                                  ;	    | or
 23063                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23064                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23065                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23066                                  ;	    | or
 23067                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23068                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23069                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23070                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23071                                  ;	    +-
 23072                                  ;
 23073                                  ;
 23074                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23075                                  ;      list.
 23076                                  ;
 23077                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23078                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23079                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23080                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23081

 23086 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23087 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23088                                  endstruc

 23170                                  ; (tm06) IF FileSW			;AN000;(Check if file spec is supported)

 23179                                  ;IF FileSW+DrvSW 			;AN000;(Check if file spec is supported)
 23180                                  
 23181                                  ; 25/10/2022

 23199                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

 23201                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23202                                  
 23203                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23204                                  ; SysParse;
 23205                                  ;
 23206                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23207                                  ;
 23208                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23209                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23210                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23211                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23212                                  ;
 23213                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23214                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23215                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23216                                  ;
 23217                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23218                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23219                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23220                                  ;
 23221                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23222                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23223                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23224                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23225                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23226                                  ;
 23227                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23228                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23229                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23230                                  ;
 23231                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23232                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23233                                  ;
 23234                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23235                                  ;
 23236                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23237                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23238                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23239                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23240                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23241                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23242                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23243                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23244                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23245                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23246                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23247                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23248                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23249                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23250                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23251                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23252                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23253                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23254                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23255                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23256                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23257                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23258                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23259                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23260                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23261                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23262                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23263                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23264                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23265                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23266                                  
 23267                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23268                                  
 23269                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23270                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23271                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23272                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23273                                  
 23274                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23275                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23276                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23277                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23278                                  ;
 23279                                  
 23280                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23281                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23282                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23283                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23284                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23285                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23286                                  
 23287                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23288                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23289                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23290                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23291                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23292                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23293                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23294                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23295                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23296                                  
 23297                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23298                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23299                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23300                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23301                                  ;	     segment.
 23302                                  
 23303                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 23304                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 23305                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020

 23307                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 23308                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 23309

 23311                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro

 23325

 23408                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 23409                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 23410                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 23411                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 23412                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 23413                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.

 23829                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23830                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23831                                  ;
 23832                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23833                                  ;
 23834                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23835                                  ;	    AL = type
 23836                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23837                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23838                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23839                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23840                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23841                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths

 23846                                  ;

 24222                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24223                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24224                                  ;
 24225                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24226                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24227                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24228                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24229                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24230                                  ;
 24231                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24232                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24233                                  ;
 24234                                  ; Output:    None
 24235                                  ;
 24236                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24237                                  ;
 24238                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24239                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24240                                  
 24241                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24242                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24243                                  
 24244                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24245 000018C5 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24246 000018C6 2E800E[3714]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24247 000018CC 2E8026[3714]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24248 000018D2 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24249 000018D5 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24250 000018D7 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24251                                  
 24252 000018D9 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24253 000018DB 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24254                                  
 24255 000018DD 2E800E[3714]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24256                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24257 000018E3 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24258                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24259 000018E4 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24260 000018E7 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24261 000018E8 C3                      	retn
 24262                                  
 24263                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24264                                  
 24265                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24266                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 24267 000018E9 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24268 000018EA 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24269 000018EB 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24270 000018EC 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24271 000018ED 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 24272 000018EF 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 24273 000018F1 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 24274                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 24275 000018F2 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 24276 000018F5 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 24277 000018F7 7442                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 24278                                  
 24279 000018F9 E8F000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 24280 000018FC 7239                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 24281                                  
 24282 000018FE 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 24283 00001900 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 24284 00001902 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 24285 00001904 D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24286 00001906 E8D100                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24287 00001909 722C                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24288                                  
 24289 0000190B 89D3                    	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 24290 0000190D 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 24291 0000190F D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 24292 00001911 D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24293 00001913 E8C400                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24294 00001916 721F                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24295                                  
 24296 00001918 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 24297 0000191A D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24298 0000191C E8BB00                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24299 0000191F 7216                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24300                                  
 24301 00001921 01DA                    	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x

 24457                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24458                                  ;
 24459                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24460                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24461                                  ;
 24462                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24463                                  ;
 24464                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24465                                  ;
 24466                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24467                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24468                                  
 24469                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24470                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24471 000019DA 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24472 000019DB 2EF606[3714]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24473 000019E1 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24474                                  
 24475 000019E3 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24476 000019E4 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24477                                  
 24478                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24479 000019E5 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24480 000019E6 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24481                                  
 24482 000019E8 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24483 000019E9 C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24484                                  
 24485                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24486 000019EA F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24487 000019EB C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25061 00001C14 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25062 00001C15 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 25063 00001C18 7404                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25064                                  
 25065 00001C1A E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 25066                                  
 25067                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 25068 00001C1C 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 25069                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 25070 00001C1E 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25071 00001C1F 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 25072 00001C20 C3                      	retn
 25073                                  
 25074                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25075                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 25076                                  ;
 25077                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 25078                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 25079                                  ;	    blanks.
 25080                                  ;
 25081                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25082                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 25083                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25084                                  ;
 25085                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 25086                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 25087                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 25088                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25089                                  
 25090                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 25091 00001C21 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25092 00001C22 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25093 00001C23 2EC606[3114]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 25094                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 25095                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 25096 00001C29 2E8026[3714]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 25097 00001C2F 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 25098 00001C31 7436                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25099                                  
 25100 00001C33 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 25101 00001C35 7432                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25102                                  
 25103 00001C37 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 25104 00001C39 7431                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25105                                  
 25106                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25107                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 25108 00001C3B 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 25109 00001C3D 750C                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25110                                  
 25111 00001C3F 803C20                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 25112 00001C42 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25113                                  
 25114 00001C44 B020                    	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 25115 00001C46 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 25116 00001C47 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 25117 00001C49 EB1E                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25118                                  
 25119                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 25120 00001C4B 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 25121                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 25122 00001C50 7217                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25123                                  
 25124                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 25125 00001C52 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 25126                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 25127 00001C54 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 25128                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25129 00001C58 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 25130 00001C5A 740B                    	jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 25131                                  
 25132 00001C5C BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 25133                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 25134 00001C5F 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25135 00001C60 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 25136 00001C63 7407                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25137                                  
 25138 00001C65 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 25139                                  
 25140                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 25141 00001C67 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 25142                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 25143                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 25144 00001C69 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25145 00001C6A 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 25146 00001C6B C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25147                                  
 25148                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 25149 00001C6C 2EA2[3114]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 25150 00001C70 2EF606[3714]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 25151 00001C76 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 25152                                  
 25153 00001C78 2E800E[3714]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 25154                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 25155                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 25156 00001C7E 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 25157 00001C80 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25158                                  
 25159                                  
 25160                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25161                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25162                                  ;
 25163                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25164                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25165                                  ;
 25166                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25167                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25168                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25169                                  ;
 25170                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25171                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25172                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25173                                  
 25174                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25175                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25176                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25177                                  ;
 25178                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25179                                  
 25180                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25181                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25182                                  
 25183                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25184                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25185 00001C82 8D2E[4014]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25186                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25187 00001C86 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25188 00001C88 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25189                                  
 25190                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25191 00001C8A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25192 00001C8C 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25193                                  
 25194 00001C8E F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25195                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25196                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25197 00001C8F C3                      	retn
 25198                                  
 25199                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25200                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25201                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25202                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25203                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25204                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25205                                  
 25206                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25207                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25208 00001C90 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25209 00001C92 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25210                                  
 25211 00001C94 2E800E[3714]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25212                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25213                                  
 25214                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25215                                  	; cf=0
 25216                                  	;retn
 25217                                  
 25218                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25219                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25220                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25221 00001C9A F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25222                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25223                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25224 00001C9B C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25225                                  
 25226                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25227                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25228                                  ;
 25229                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25230                                  ;
 25231                                  ;  Input:
 25232                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25233                                  ;
 25234                                  ;  Output:
 25235                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25236                                  ;
 25237                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25238                                  ;
 25239                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25240                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25241                                  
 25242                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25243 00001C9C 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25244 00001C9D 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25245 00001C9E 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25246                                  	
 25247 00001C9F 2E833E[3414]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25248 00001CA5 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25249                                  
 25250 00001CA7 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25251 00001CA8 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25252 00001CA9 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25253 00001CAA 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25254 00001CAB 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25255 00001CAC 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25256 00001CAD 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25257 00001CAE 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25258 00001CB0 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 25259 00001CB2 B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25260 00001CB5 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25261                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25262 00001CB7 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25263 00001CB9 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25264 00001CBB 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25265 00001CBC 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25266 00001CBD 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25267 00001CBE 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25268 00001CBF 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25269 00001CC0 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25270 00001CC1 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25271 00001CC2 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25272                                  
 25273                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25274 00001CC4 2E8936[3214]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25275 00001CC9 2E891E[3414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25276                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25277 00001CCE 2E8B36[3214]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25278 00001CD3 2E8E1E[3414]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25279                                  
 25280                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25281 00001CD8 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25282 00001CDB 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25283                                  
 25284 00001CDD 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25285 00001CDF 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25286                                  
 25287 00001CE1 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25288 00001CE4 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25289                                  
 25290 00001CE6 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25291 00001CE7 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25292                                  
 25293                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25294 00001CE9 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25295 00001CEA 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25296                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25297 00001CEB EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25298                                  
 25299                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25300                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25301                                  	; cf=0
 25302                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25303                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25304 00001CED 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25305 00001CEE 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25306 00001CEF 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25307 00001CF0 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25860                                  
 25861                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25862                                  
 25863                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25864                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25865                                  
 25866                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25867                                  ;
 25868                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25869                                  ;
 25870                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25871                                  ;
 25872                                  ;   Modification log:
 25873                                  ;
 25874                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25875                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25876                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25877                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25878                                  ;
 25879                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25880                                  ;
 25881                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25882                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25883                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25884                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25885                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25886                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25887                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25888                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25889                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25890                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25891                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25892                                  ;
 25893                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25894                                  
 25895                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25896                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25897                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25898                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25899                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25900                                  
 25901                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25902                                  
 25903                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25904                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25905                                  
 25906                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25907                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25908                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25909                                  
 25910                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25911                                  ;
 25912                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25913                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25914                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25915                                  ;	           line.
 25916                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25917                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25918                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25919                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25920                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25921                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25922                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25923                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25924                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25925                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25926                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25927                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25928                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25929                                  ;	           for details).
 25930                                  
 25931                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25932                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25933                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25934                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25935                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25936                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25937                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25938                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25939                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25940                                  
 25941                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25942                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25943                                  
 25944                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25945                                  
 25946                                  %endif
 25947                                  
 25948                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 25949                                  
 25950                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 25951                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 25952                                  
 25953                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25954                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 25955                                  
 25956                                  		;public	DevEntry
 25957                                  
 25958 00001ED4 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25959 00001ED6 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25960 00001ED8 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25961 00001EDA 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25962 00001EDE 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 25963                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 25964                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25965                                  ;
 25966 00001EE2 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 25967 00001EE3 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25968 00001EE5 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25969 00001EE7 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 25970                                  ;
 25971 00001EE9 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 25972                                  ;

 25975                                  ;

 25977                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB

 25979                                  ;

 26111 00001F72 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted

 26169 00001F9A 0E                      	push	cs
 26170 00001F9B 1F                      	pop	ds
 26171                                  
 26172 00001F9C 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10

 26180                                  
 26181 00001FA8 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]

 26184 00001FB2 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 26185 00001FB6 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount

 26189                                  
 26190                                  getcom:

 26192 00001FC2 E86007                  	call	getchr
 26193                                  conflp: 
 26194 00001FC5 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 26195                                  
 26196 00001FC7 FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 26197                                  
 26198 00001FCB C606[2114]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 26199 00001FD0 C606[2414]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 26200 00001FD5 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 26201 00001FD7 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 26202                                  
 26203                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26204                                  %if 0
 26205                                  
 26206                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26207                                  
 26208                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26209                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26210                                  
 26211                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26212                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26213                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26214                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26215                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26216                                  
 26217                                          push    ax                      ;
 26218                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26219                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26220                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26221                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26222                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26223                                          pop     ax
 26224                                  ;
 26225                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26226                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26227                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26228                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26229                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26230                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26231                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26232                                  ;   spot.
 26233                                  ;
 26234                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26235                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26236                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26237                                  ;   retrieved.
 26238                                  ;
 26239                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26240                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26241                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26242                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26243                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26244                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26245                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26246                                  final:                                  ;
 26247                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26248                                  not_final:                              ;
 26249                                  ;endif
 26250                                  
 26251                                  %endif
 26252 00001FD9 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26253 00001FDB E84707                  	call	getchr
 26254 00001FDE 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26255                                  
 26256 00001FE0 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 26257                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 26258                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26259 00001FE5 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26260 00001FE7 E90707                  	jmp	badop
 26261                                  	
 26262                                  coff:	
 26263                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26264                                  	; ds = cs
 26265                                  	;push	cs
 26266                                  	;pop	ds
 26267 00001FEA E89D10                  	call	newline
