 26271 00001FEF E83307                  	call	getchr
 26272 00001FF2 EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 26273                                  
 26274                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26275                                  ; 11/12/2022
 26276                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 26277                                  ;coff_p:
 26278                                  	;push	cs
 26279                                  	;pop	ds
 26280                                  
 26281                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 26282                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 26283                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 26284                                  ;install= command.
 26285                                  
 26286                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26287                                  ;install command
 26288                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26289                                  
 26290                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26291                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 26292                                  tryi:
 26293 00001FF4 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 26294 00001FF9 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 26295 00001FFB E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 26296                                  not_init_pass:
 26297 00001FFE 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 26298                                          ; 11/12/2022
 26299                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 26300 00002003 74E5                    	je	short coff
 26301                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26302                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26303                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 26304                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 26305                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 26306                                  					; and before install= commands
 26307                                  					; are processed
 26308                                  
 26309 00002005 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 26310 0000200A 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 26311 0000200C 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 26312                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26313                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 26314 0000200F 74D9                    	je	short coff
 26315                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26316                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26317                                  
 26318                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 26319                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 26320                                          
 26321 00002011 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 26322                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 26323                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26324 00002014 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 26325                                  	
 26326                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 26327 00002016 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26328                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 26329 0000201B EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 26330                                  
 26331                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26332                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 26333                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 26334                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 26335                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26336                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26337                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 26338                                  
 26339                                  multi_try_i:
 26340 0000201D 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 26341                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 26342                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26343 00002020 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 26344                                  
 26345                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26346                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26347                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26348                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26349                                  ;;endif
 26350                                  
 26351 00002022 E80CF0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26352 00002025 EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 26353                                  
 26354                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26355                                  %if 0
 26356                                  
 26357                                  multi_try_n:
 26358                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 26359                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 26360                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26361                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26362                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26363                                  ;endif
 26364                                  
 26365                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 26366                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 26367                                  
 26368                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 26369                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 26370                                  	mov	bx,ax
 26371                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 26372                                  
 26373                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 26374                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 26375                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 26376                                  
 26377                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 26378                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 26379                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 26380                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 26381                                  
 26382                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 26383                                  	mov	bx,1
 26384                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 26385                                  
 26386                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26387                                  
 26388                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 26389                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 26390                                          int     21h
 26391                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 26392                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 26393                                          int     21h
 26394                                  
 26395                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 26396                                  
 26397                                  %endif
 26398                                  
 26399                                  multi_pass_filter:
 26400 00002027 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 26401 0000202A 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26402 0000202C 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 26403 0000202F 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26404 00002031 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 26405 00002034 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 26406                                  
 26407                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 26408 00002036 FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 26409 0000203A FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 26410                                  
 26411                                  multi_pass_coff:
 26412                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26413 0000203E EBAA                    	jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.
 26414                                  
 26415                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26416                                  ; buffer command
 26417                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26418                                  
 26419                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26420                                  ;									      *
 26421                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26422                                  ;									      *
 26423                                  ; input :								      *
 26424                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26425                                  ; output:								      *
 26426                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26427                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26428                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26429                                  ;									      *
 26430                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26431                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26432                                  ; logic:								      *
 26433                                  ; {									      *
 26434                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26435                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26436                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26437                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26438                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26439                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26440                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26441                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26442                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26443                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26444                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *

 26542                                  ;****************************************************************************

 27966                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27967                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27968                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27969                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27970                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27971                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27972                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27973                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27974                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27975                                  
 27976                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27977                                  ;									  *
 27978                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27979                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27980                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27981                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27982                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27983                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27984                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27985                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27986                                  ; input :								  *
 27987                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27988                                  ; output:								  *
 27989                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27990                                  ;									  *
 27991                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27992                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27993                                  ; logic:								  *
 27994                                  ; {									  *
 27995                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27996                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27997                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27998                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27999                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28000                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28001                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28002                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28003                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28004                                  ;	     }								  *
 28005                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 28006                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 28007                                  ;	};								  *
 28008                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 28009                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 28010                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 28011                                  ; };									  *
 28012                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28013

 28444                                  ;***********************************************************************
 28445                                  ;								       *
 28446                                  ; function: parse the option switches specified.		       *
 28447                                  ; note - this command is intended for the future use also.	       *
 28448                                  ; when we need to set system data flag,use this command.	       *
 28449                                  ;								       *
 28450                                  ; input :							       *
 28451                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.			       *
 28452                                  ; output:							       *
 28453                                  ;	p_swit_k set if /k option chosen.			       *
 28454                                  ;								       *
 28455                                  ; subroutines to be called:					       *
 28456                                  ;	sysinit_parse						       *
 28457                                  ; logic:							       *
 28458                                  ; {								       *
 28459                                  ;	set di points to swit_parms;  /*parse control definition*/     *
 28460                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 					       *
 28461                                  ;	while (end of command line)				       *
 28462                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;					       *

 28464                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == swit_k) then	       *
 28465                                  ;		    p_swit_k = 1				       *
 28466                                  ;	       endif						       *

 28682                                  
 28683                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28684                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28685                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28686                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28687                                  ;
 28688                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28689                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28690                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28691                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28692                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28693                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28694                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28695                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28696                                  ;	 procedure.
 28697                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28698                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28699                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28700                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28701                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer

 28939                                  	;pop	ds

 28942 00002749 B90A00                  	mov	cx,10		; decimal divide factor

 29026                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29027                                  ;
 29028                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29029                                  ;
 29030                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29031                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29032                                  ;
 29033                                  ;	Output : none
 29034                                  ;
 29035                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 29036                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29037                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29038                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29039                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29040                                  ;
 29041                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29042                                  
 29043                                  LieInt12Mem:
 29044                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29045                                  	; ds = cs
 29046 0000278E A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 29047                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 29048                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 29049 00002791 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 29050 00002794 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29051                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29052                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29053                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 29054                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 29055                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29056                                  	; ds = cs
 29057 00002796 803E[F11E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 29058 0000279B 74F0                    	je	short limx
 29059 0000279D A1[D81E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 29060                                  lim_set:
 29061                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29062                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29063                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 29064                                  ;limx:
 29065                                  	;retn
 29066                                  	
 29067                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 29068                                  
 29069                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29070                                  ;
 29071                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29072                                  ;
 29073                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29074                                  ;	Output : none
 29075                                  ;
 29076                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29077                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29078                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29079                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29080                                  ;
 29081                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29082                                  
 29083                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29084                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29085 000027A0 1E                      	push	ds
 29086 000027A1 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29087 000027A4 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29088 000027A6 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29089 000027AA 2E891E[F51E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29090 000027AF B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29091 000027B1 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29092 000027B3 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29093 000027B6 2EC606[F41E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29094 000027BC 1F                      	pop	ds
 29095                                  ;limx:
 29096 000027BD C3                      	retn
 29097                                  
 29098                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29099                                  ;
 29100                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29101                                  ;
 29102                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29103                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29104                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29105                                  ;
 29106                                  ;	Output : none
 29107                                  ;
 29108                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29109                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29110                                  ;
 29111                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29112                                  
 29113                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29114                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29115                                  	; ds = cs
 29116 000027BE 803E[F41E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29117                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29118                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29119                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29120 000027C3 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29121                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29122 000027C5 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29123 000027C8 8826[F41E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29124                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29125                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29126 000027CC 1E                      	push	ds
 29127                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29128 000027CD 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29129 000027CF 2EA1[F51E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29130 000027D3 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 29131 000027D6 1F                      	pop	ds
 29132                                  timx:
 29133 000027D7 C3                      	retn
 29134

 29181                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29182                                  
 29183                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29184                                  
 29185                                  %if 0
 29186                                  
 29187                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29188                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29189                                  
 29190                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29191                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29192                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29193                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29194                                  
 29195                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29196                                  ;
 29197                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29198                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29199                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29200                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29201                                  ;
 29202                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29203                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29204                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29205                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29206                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29207                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29208                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29209                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29210                                  ; available during the load.
 29211                                  ;
 29212                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29213                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29214                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29215                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29216                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29217                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29218                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29219                                  ;
 29220                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29221                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29222                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29223                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29224                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29225                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29226                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29227                                  ;
 29228                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29229                                  
 29230                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29231                                  
 29232                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29233                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29234                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29235                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29236                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29237                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29238                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29239                                  
 29240                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29241                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29242                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29243                                  
 29244                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29245                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29246                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29247                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29248                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29249                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29250                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29251                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29252                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29253                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29254                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29255                                  
 29256                                  InitVar:
 29257                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29258                                  	push	ax
 29259                                  	push	cx
 29260                                  	push	di
 29261                                  	push	es
 29262                                  
 29263                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29264                                  	push	cs
 29265                                  	pop	es
 29266                                  
 29267                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29268                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29269                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29270                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29271                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29272                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29273                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29274                                  
 29275                                  	cld
 29276                                  
 29277                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29278                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29279                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29280                                  
 29281                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29282                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29283                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29284                                  
 29285                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29286                                  
 29287                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29288                                  	pop	es
 29289                                  	pop	di
 29290                                  	pop	cx
 29291                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29292                                  
 29293                                  	retn
 29294                                  
 29295                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29296                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29297                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29298                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29299                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29300                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29301                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29302                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29303                                  
 29304                                  FixMem:
 29305                                  	push	ax
 29306                                  	push	bx
 29307                                  	push	cx
 29308                                  	push	dx
 29309                                  	push	es
 29310                                  
 29311                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29312                                  
 29313                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29314                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29315                                  
 29316                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29317                                  
 29318                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29319                                  
 29320                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29321                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29322                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29323                                  
 29324                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29325                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29326                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29327                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29328                                  
 29329                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29330                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29331                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29332                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29333                                  
 29334                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29335                                  
 29336                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29337                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29338                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29339                                  
 29340                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29341                                  	add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29342                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29343                                  
 29344                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29345                                  
 29346                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29347                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29348                                  
 29349                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29350                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29351                                  	inc	bx
 29352                                  	mov	es,bx
 29353                                  
 29354                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29355                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29356                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29357                                  fmX:	
 29358                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29359                                  
 29360                                  	pop	es
 29361                                  	pop	dx
 29362                                  	pop	cx
 29363                                  	pop	bx
 29364                                  	pop	ax
 29365                                  
 29366                                  	retn
 29367                                  
 29368                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29369                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29370                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29371                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29372                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29373                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29374                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29375                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29376                                  
 29377                                  fm_link:
 29378                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29379                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29380                                  
 29381                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29382                                  	;
 29383                                  	;push	es
 29384                                  	;push	cs
 29385                                  	;pop	es
 29386                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29387                                  	;pop	es
 29388                                  	
 29389                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 29390                                  
 29391                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29392                                  	mov	bx,1
 29393                                  	int	21h
 29394                                  	retn
 29395                                  
 29396                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29397                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 29398                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29399                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 29400                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29401                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29402                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29403                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29404                                  
 29405                                  fm_unlink:
 29406                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29407                                  	
 29408                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29409                                  	;
 29410                                  	;push	ds
 29411                                  	;push	cs
 29412                                  	;pop	ds
 29413                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29414                                  	;pop	ds
 29415                                  	
 29416                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29417                                  
 29418                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29419                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29420                                  	retn
 29421                                  
 29422                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29423                                  
 29424                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29425                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29426                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29427                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29428                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29429                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29430                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29431                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29432                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29433                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29434                                  ;
 29435                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29436                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29437                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29438                                  ;
 29439                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29440                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29441                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29442                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29443                                  ;
 29444                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29445                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29446                                  ;
 29447                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29448                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29449                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29450                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29451                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29452                                  ;     lh
 29453                                  ;     /l
 29454                                  ;     1
 29455                                  ;     1000
 29456                                  ;     2
 29457                                  ;     print
 29458                                  ;     /d
 29459                                  ;     :lpt2
 29460                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29461                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29462                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29463                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29464                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29465                                  ; for:
 29466                                  ;    Each /L
 29467                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29468                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29469                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29470                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29471                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29472                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29473                                  
 29474                                  ParseVar:
 29475                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29476                                  	push	di
 29477                                  	push	ds
 29478                                  	push	es
 29479                                  
 29480                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29481                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29482                                  	cld
 29483                                  
 29484                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29485                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29486                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29487                                  
 29488                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29489                                  	call	isWhite
 29490                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29491                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29492                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29493                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29494                                  
 29495                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29496                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29497                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29498                                  
 29499                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29500                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29501                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29502                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29503                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29504                                  	jne	short pv30
 29505                                  
 29506                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29507                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29508                                  
 29509                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29510                                  	;
 29511                                  	;push	es
 29512                                  	;push	cs
 29513                                  	;pop	es
 29514                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29515                                  	;pop	es
 29516                                  
 29517                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29518                                  
 29519                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29520                                  
 29521                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29522                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29523                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29524                                  
 29525                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29526                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29527                                  
 29528                                  	call	parseL
 29529                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29530                                  
 29531                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29532                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29533                                  
 29534                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29535                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29536                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29537                                  	dec	si
 29538                                  	stc
 29539                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29540                                  	pop	es
 29541                                  	pop	ds
 29542                                  	pop	di
 29543                                  	retn
 29544                                  
 29545                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29546                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29547                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29548                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29549                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29550                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29551                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29552                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29553                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29554                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29555                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29556                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29557                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29558                                  
 29559                                  parseL:
 29560                                  	lodsb
 29561                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29562                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29563                                  
 29564                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29565                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29566                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29567                                  
 29568                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29569                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29570                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29571                                  
 29572                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29573                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29574                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29575                                  
 29576                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29577                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29578                                  
 29579                                  	lodsb
 29580                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29581                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29582                                  
 29583                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29584                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29585                                  
 29586                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29587                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29588                                  
 29589                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29590                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29591                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29592                                  
 29593                                  	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29594                                  	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29595                                  
 29596                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29597                                  
 29598                                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29599                                  	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29600                                  
 29601                                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29602                                  
 29603                                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29604                                  
 29605                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29606                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29607                                  
 29608                                  	lodsb
 29609                                  	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29610                                  	je	short pl10	;
 29611                                  
 29612                                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29613                                  	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29614                                  
 29615                                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29616                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29617                                  
 29618                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29619                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29620                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29621                                  plE1:	
 29622                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29623                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29624                                  	dec	si
 29625                                  	stc
 29626                                  	retn
 29627                                  
 29628                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29629                                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29630                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29631                                  	; cf=1
 29632                                  	;stc
 29633                                  	retn
 29634                                  plSwX:	
 29635                                  	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29636                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29637                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29638                                  	; cf=0
 29639                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29640                                  	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29641                                  
 29642                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29643                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 29644                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29645                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29646                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29647                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29648                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 29649                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29650                                  
 29651                                  ;incArgc:
 29652                                  	;push	ax
 29653                                  
 29654                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 29655                                  
 29656                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 29657                                  
 29658                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 29659                                  
 29660                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 29661                                  
 29662                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 29663                                  
 29664                                  	;pop	ax
 29665                                  	;retn
 29666                                  
 29667                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29668                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29669                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29670                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29671                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29672                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29673                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29674                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29675                                  
 29676                                  isEOL:
 29677                                  	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29678                                  	je	short ieX
 29679                                  	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29680                                  	je	short ieX
 29681                                  	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29682                                  ieX:	
 29683                                  	retn
 29684                                  
 29685                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29686                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29687                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29688                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29689                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29690                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29691                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29692                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29693                                  
 29694                                  isWhite:
 29695                                  	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29696                                  	je	short iwX
 29697                                  	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29698                                  	je	short iwX
 29699                                  	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29700                                  iwX:	
 29701                                  	retn
 29702                                  
 29703                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29704                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 29705                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29706                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 29707                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29708                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29709                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29710                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29711                                  
 29712                                  unMarkUMB:
 29713                                  	push	ax
 29714                                  	push	bx
 29715                                  	push	di
 29716                                  	push	es
 29717                                  
 29718                                  	push	cs
 29719                                  	pop	es
 29720                                  
 29721                                  	xor	ah,ah
 29722                                  	mov	bx,ax
 29723                                  
 29724                                  	; 19/04/2019
 29725                                  	
 29726                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 29727                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbUsed],ah ; 0
 29728                                  
 29729                                  	cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 29730                                  	jne	short umu10
 29731                                  
 29732                                  	;mov	[es:UmbLoad],0	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 29733                                  	mov	[es:UmbLoad],ah ; 0
 29734                                  umu10:	
 29735                                  	pop	es
 29736                                  	pop	di
 29737                                  	pop	bx
 29738                                  	pop	ax
 29739                                  	retn
 29740                                  
 29741                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29742                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 29743                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 29744                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 29745                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 29746                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29747                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 29748                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29749                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 29750                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29751                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29752                                  
 29753                                  stowUMB:
 29754                                  	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 29755                                  	jb	short su10
 29756                                  	stc
 29757                                  	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 29758                                  su10:	
 29759                                  	push	bx
 29760                                  	push	di
 29761                                  	push	si
 29762                                  	push	ds
 29763                                  	push	es
 29764                                  	push	cs
 29765                                  	pop	es
 29766                                  	push	cs
 29767                                  	pop	ds
 29768                                  	
 29769                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 29770                                  	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 29771                                  	jne	short su20
 29772                                  	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29773                                  su20:	
 29774                                  	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 29775                                  	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 29776                                  
 29777                                  	mov	bl,al
 29778                                  	xor	bh,bh
 29779                                  	mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 29780                                  
 29781                                  	xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29782                                  
 29783                                  	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 29784                                  	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 29785                                  
 29786                                  	stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 29787                                  su30:	
 29788                                  	pop	es
 29789                                  	pop	ds
 29790                                  	pop	si
 29791                                  	pop	di
 29792                                  	pop	bx
 29793                                  	retn
 29794                                  
 29795                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29796                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 29797                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29798                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 29799                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29800                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29801                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29802                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29803                                  
 29804                                  ; 13/05/2019
 29805                                  
 29806                                  stowSiz:
 29807                                  	push	bx
 29808                                  	;push	di ; ?
 29809                                  	push	es
 29810                                  
 29811                                  	push	cs
 29812                                  	pop	es	
 29813                                  
 29814                                  	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 29815                                  	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 29816                                  	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 29817                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 29818                                  	
 29819                                  	pop	es
 29820                                  	;pop	di ; ?
 29821                                  	pop	bx
 29822                                  
 29823                                  	retn
 29824                                  
 29825                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29826                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 29827                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 29828                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 29829                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 29830                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29831                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 29832                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 29833                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 29834                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 29835                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29836                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29837                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29838                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29839                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29840                                  
 29841                                  gnradix:
 29842                                  	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 29843                                  
 29844                                  toDigit:
 29845                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29846                                  	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 29847                                  
 29848                                  toDigit_hex:
 29849                                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 29850                                  	jb	short td10
 29851                                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 29852                                  	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 29853                                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 29854                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29855                                  	retn
 29856                                  td10:	
 29857                                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 29858                                  	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 29859                                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 29860                                  	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 29861                                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 29862                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29863                                  	retn
 29864                                  toDigit_dec:
 29865                                  td20:	
 29866                                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 29867                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 29868                                  	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 29869                                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 29870                                  	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 29871                                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 29872                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29873                                  	retn
 29874                                  tdE:	
 29875                                  	stc
 29876                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 29877                                  	retn
 29878                                  
 29879                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29880                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 29881                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29882                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 29883                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 29884                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 29885                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 29886                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29887                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29888                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29889                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
