 32740                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32741                                  ; SYSINIT2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 32742                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32743                                  ; 14/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32744                                  
 32745                                  ; Multiple configuration block support  Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 32746                                  ;
 32747                                  ; Summary:
 32748                                  ;
 32749                                  ;   The procedure "organize" crunches the in-memory copy of config.sys
 32750                                  ;   into lines delimited by CR/LF (sometimes no CR, but *always* an LF)
 32751                                  ;   with the leading "keyword=" replaced by single character codes (eg, B
 32752                                  ;   for BUFFERS, D for DEVICE, Z for any unrecognized keyword); see comtab
 32753                                  ;   and/or config.inc for the full list.
 32754                                  ;
 32755                                  ;   [blockname] and INCLUDE are the major syntactical additions for multi-
 32756                                  ;   configuration support. blockname is either MENU, which contains one
 32757                                  ;   or more MENUITEM lines, an optional MENUDEFAULT (which includes optional
 32758                                  ;   time-out), or any user-defined keyword, such as NETWORK, CD-ROM, etc.
 32759                                  ;   INCLUDE allows the current block to name another block for inclusion
 32760                                  ;   during the processing phase of CONFIG.SYS. An INCLUDE is only honored
 32761                                  ;   once, precluding nasty infinite-loop scenarios. If blocks are present
 32762                                  ;   without a MENU block, then only lines inside COMMON blocks are processed.
 32763                                  ;
 32764                                  ; Example:
 32765                                  ;
 32766                                  ;   [menu]
 32767                                  ;   menuitem=misc,Miscellaneous
 32768                                  ;   menuitem=network,Network Configuration
 32769                                  ;   menudefault=network,15
 32770                                  ;
 32771                                  ;   [network]
 32772                                  ;   include misc
 32773                                  ;   device=foo
 32774                                  ;
 32775                                  ;   [misc]
 32776                                  ;   device=bar
 32777                                  ;   include alternate
 32778                                  ;
 32779                                  ;   [alternate]
 32780                                  ;   device=tar
 32781                                  ;
 32782                                  ;
 32783                                  ;   When the menu is displayed
 32784                                  ;
 32785                                  ;    1. Miscellaneous
 32786                                  ;    2. Network Configuration
 32787                                  ;
 32788                                  ;   #2 is highlighted as the default option, and will be automatically
 32789                                  ;   selected after 15 seconds. It will invoke the following lines in the
 32790                                  ;   following order:
 32791                                  ;
 32792                                  ;       DEVICE=BAR
 32793                                  ;       DEVICE=TAR
 32794                                  ;       DEVICE=FOO
 32795                                  ;
 32796                                  
 32797                                  ;MULTI_CONFIG equ 1
 32798                                  
 32799                                  ; the following depend on the positions of the various letters in switchlist
 32800                                  
 32801                                  switchnum	equ 11111000b ; 0F8h	; which switches require number
 32802                                  
 32803                                  flagec35	equ 00000100b ; 4	; electrically compatible 3.5 inch disk drive
 32804                                  flagdrive	equ 00001000b ; 8 
 32805                                  flagcyln	equ 00010000b ; 16
 32806                                  flagseclim	equ 00100000b ; 32
 32807                                  flagheads	equ 01000000b ; 64
 32808                                  flagff		equ 10000000b ; 128
 32809                                  
 32810                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32811                                  ; 19/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32812                                  
 32813                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3E78h
 32814                                  
 32815                                  ; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32816                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3054h
 32817                                  
 32818 00002CB5 00                      insert_blank:	db 	0

 32831 00002CB7 50                      	push	ax
 32832 00002CB8 53                      	push	bx
 32833 00002CB9 51                      	push	cx
 32834 00002CBA 52                      	push	dx
 32835                                  
 32836 00002CBB 0E                      	push	cs
 32837 00002CBC 1F                      	pop	ds
 32838                                  
 32839 00002CBD 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 32840 00002CBF 8A1E[F836]              	mov	bl,[drive]
 32841                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32842 00002CC3 43                      	inc	bx

 32844                                  					; (1=a,2=b...)
 32845 00002CC4 BA[D035]                	mov	dx,deviceparameters

 32847 00002CC9 B00D                    	mov	al,GENERIC_IOCTL ; 0Dh
 32848 00002CCB B508                    	mov	ch,RAWIO ; 8
 32849 00002CCD B140                    	mov	cl,SET_DEVICE_PARAMETERS ; 40h

 32853                                  ;

 32860                                  ;	test	word [cs:switches],flagec35 ; 4

 32871 00002CD8 8A0E[F836]              	mov	cl,[drive]
 32872 00002CDC B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h	
 32873 00002CDF 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax

 32876 00002CE3 D2E0                    	shl	al,cl			; set proper bit depending on drive
 32877                                  	;or	[531h],al ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS Offset SYINIT:3EACh)
 32878 00002CE5 0806[3105]              	or	[ec35_flag],al		; set the bit in the permanent flags
 32879

 32881                                  ;

 32884                                  ;;	sectors per track than any old ones.

 32895 00002CEA 59                      	pop	cx

 32914 00002CF2 C706[D435]5000          	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 32915                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+1],2
 32916 00002CF8 C606[D135]02            	mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_3INCH720KB ; 2
 32917                                  	;mov	word [deviceparameters+2],0
 32918 00002CFD C706[D235]0000          	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES],0

 32924                                  %if 0

 32927                                  
 32928                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32929                                  ;
 32930                                  ; procedure : parseline
 32931                                  ;
 32932                                  ; entry point is parseline. al contains the first character in command line.
 32933                                  ;
 32934                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32935                                  
 32936                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32937                                  	; (SYSINIT:30ACh)
 32938                                  
 32939                                  parseline:
 32940                                  	push	ds
 32941                                  
 32942                                  	push	cs
 32943                                  	pop	ds
 32944                                  
 32945                                  nextswtch:
 32946                                  	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 32947                                  	je	short done_line
 32948                                  	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 32949                                  	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 32950                                  
 32951                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 32952                                  
 32953                                  	cmp	al,' '                  ; space?
 32954                                  	jbe	short getnext		; skip over space
 32955                                  	cmp	al,'/'
 32956                                  	je	short getparm
 32957                                  	stc				; mark error invalid-character-in-input
 32958                                  	jmp	short exitpl
 32959                                  
 32960                                  getparm:
 32961                                  	call	check_switch
 32962                                  	mov	[switches],bx		; save switches read so far
 32963                                  	jc	short swterr
 32964                                  getnext:
 32965                                  	call	getchr
 32966                                  	jc	short done_line
 32967                                  	jmp	short nextswtch
 32968                                  swterr:
 32969                                  	jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error
 32970                                  
 32971                                  done_line:
 32972                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32973                                  	test	byte [switches],flagdrive ; 8
 32974                                  	;test	word [switches],flagdrive ; 8 ; see if drive specified
 32975                                  	jnz	short okay
 32976                                  	stc				; mark error no-drive-specified
 32977                                  	jmp	short exitpl
 32978                                  
 32979                                  okay:
 32980                                  	mov	ax,[switches]
 32981                                  	and	ax,0003h	    ; get flag bits for changeline and non-rem
 32982                                  	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES],ax
 32983                                  	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES],0
 32984                                  	;clc			    ; everything is fine
 32985                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32986                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32987                                  	; cf=0
 32988                                  	;clc
 32989                                  	call	setdeviceparameters
 32990                                  exitpl:
 32991                                  	pop	ds
 32992                                  	retn
 32993                                  put_back:
 32994                                  	inc	word [count]		; one more char to scan
 32995                                  	dec	word [chrptr]		; back up over linefeed
 32996                                  	jmp	short done_line
 32997                                  
 32998                                  %endif
 32999                                  
 33000                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33001                                  ;
 33002                                  ; procedure : check_switch
 33003                                  ;
 33004                                  ; processes a switch in the input. it ensures that the switch is valid, and
 33005                                  ; gets the number, if any required, following the switch. the switch and the
 33006                                  ; number *must* be separated by a colon. carry is set if there is any kind of
 33007                                  ; error.
 33008                                  ;
 33009                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33010                                  
 33011                                  check_switch:
 33012 00002D0B E817FA                  	call	getchr
 33013                                  	;jc	short err_check
 33014 00002D0E 724E                    	jc	short err_chk
 33015 00002D10 24DF                            and     al,0DFh                 ; convert it to upper case
 33016 00002D12 3C41                    	cmp	al,'A'
 33017                                  	;jb	short err_check
 33018 00002D14 7248                    	jb	short err_chk ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33019 00002D16 3C5A                    	cmp	al,'Z'
 33020 00002D18 7743                    	ja	short err_check
 33021                                  
 33022 00002D1A 06                      	push	es
 33023                                  
 33024 00002D1B 0E                      	push	cs
 33025 00002D1C 07                      	pop	es
 33026                                  
 33027 00002D1D 8A0E[8C37]              	mov	cl,[switchlist]		; get number of valid switches
 33028 00002D21 B500                    	mov	ch,0
 33029 00002D23 BF[8D37]                	mov	di,1+switchlist		; point to string of valid switches
 33030 00002D26 F2AE                    	repne	scasb
 33031                                  
 33032 00002D28 07                      	pop	es
 33033 00002D29 7532                    	jnz	short err_check
 33034                                  
 33035 00002D2B B80100                  	mov	ax,1
 33036 00002D2E D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl			; set bit to indicate switch
 33037 00002D30 8B1E[F936]              	mov	bx,[switches]		; get switches so far
 33038 00002D34 09C3                    	or	bx,ax			; save this with other switches
 33039 00002D36 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 33040                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33041 00002D38 A8F8                    	test	al,switchnum ; 0F8h
 33042                                  	;test	ax,switchnum ; 0F8h	; test against switches that require number to follow
 33043 00002D3A 741E                    	jz	short done_swtch
 33044                                  
 33045 00002D3C E8E6F9                  	call	getchr
 33046 00002D3F 721A                    	jc	short err_swtch
 33047                                  
 33048 00002D41 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'
 33049 00002D43 7516                    	jne	short err_swtch
 33050                                  
 33051 00002D45 E8DDF9                  	call	getchr
 33052 00002D48 53                      	push	bx			; preserve switches
 33053                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33054                                  	;mov	byte [cs:sepchr],' '	; allow space separators
 33055                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33056                                  	; ds = cs
 33057 00002D49 C606[2A03]20            	mov	byte [sepchr],' '
 33058 00002D4E E8D803                  	call	getnum
 33059                                  	;mov	byte [cs:sepchr],0
 33060                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33061 00002D51 C606[2A03]00            	mov	byte [sepchr],0
 33062 00002D56 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore switches
 33063                                  
 33064                                  ; because getnum does not consider carriage-return or line-feed as ok, we do
 33065                                  ; not check for carry set here. if there is an error, it will be detected
 33066                                  ; further on (hopefully).
 33067                                  
 33068 00002D57 E80500                  	call	process_num
 33069                                  
 33070                                  done_swtch:
 33071                                  	;clc
 33072                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33073                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33074                                  	; cf=0
 33075                                  	;clc
 33076 00002D5A C3                      	retn
 33077                                  
 33078                                  err_swtch:
 33079 00002D5B 31CB                    	xor	bx,cx			; remove this switch from the records
 33080                                  err_check:
 33081 00002D5D F9                      	stc
 33082                                  err_chk:
 33083 00002D5E C3                      	retn
 33084                                  
 33085                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33086                                  ;
 33087                                  ; procedure : process_num
 33088                                  ;
 33089                                  ; this routine takes the switch just input, and the number following (if any),
 33090                                  ; and sets the value in the appropriate variable. if the number input is zero
 33091                                  ; then it does nothing - it assumes the default value that is present in the
 33092                                  ; variable at the beginning. zero is ok for form factor and drive, however.
 33093                                  ;
 33094                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33095                                  
 33096                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 33097                                  	; (SYSINIT:3156h)
 33098                                  process_num:
 33099 00002D5F 850E[F936]              	test	[switches],cx		; if this switch has been done before,
 33100 00002D63 752B                    	jnz	short done_ret		; ignore this one.
 33101                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33102 00002D65 F6C108                  	test	cl,flagdrive ; 8
 33103                                  	;test	cx,flagdrive ; 8
 33104 00002D68 7404                    	jz	short try_f
 33105 00002D6A A2[F836]                	mov	byte [drive],al
 33106                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33107                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 33108                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33109                                  	; cf=0
 33110 00002D6D C3                      	retn	; 13/05/2019
 33111                                  try_f:
 33112                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33113 00002D6E F6C180                  	test	cl,flagff ; 80h
 33114                                  	;test	cx,flagff ; 80h
 33115 00002D71 7404                    	jz	short try_t
 33116                                  
 33117                                  ; ensure that we do not get bogus form factors that are not supported
 33118                                  
 33119                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+1],al
 33120 00002D73 A2[D135]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],al
 33121                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33122                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 33123                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33124                                  	; cf=0
 33125 00002D76 C3                      	retn	; 13/05/2019
 33126                                  try_t:
 33127 00002D77 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 33128 00002D79 7415                    	jz	short done_ret		; if number entered was 0, assume default value
 33129                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33130 00002D7B F6C110                  	test	cl,flagcyln ; 10h
 33131                                  	;test	cx,flagcyln ; 10h
 33132 00002D7E 7404                    	jz	short try_s
 33133                                  
 33134                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+4],ax
 33135 00002D80 A3[D435]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],ax
 33136                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33137                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 33138                                  	; 12/12/2022

 33172                                  ; procedure : parseline
 33173                                  ;
 33174                                  ; entry point is parseline. al contains the first character in command line.
 33175                                  ;
 33176                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33177                                  
 33178                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 33179                                  	; (SYSINIT:30ACh)
 33180                                  parseline:
 33181                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33182                                  	; ds = cs ; *
 33183                                  
 33184                                  	;push	ds ; *
 33185                                  
 33186                                  	;push	cs ; *
 33187                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 33188                                  
 33189                                  nextswtch:
 33190 00002D91 3C0D                    	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 33191 00002D93 741C                    	je	short done_line
 33192 00002D95 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 33193 00002D97 7421                    	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 33194                                  
 33195                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 33196                                  
 33197 00002D99 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '                  ; space?
 33198 00002D9B 760F                    	jbe	short getnext		; skip over space
 33199 00002D9D 3C2F                    	cmp	al,'/'
 33200 00002D9F 7402                    	je	short getparm
 33201 00002DA1 F9                      	stc				; mark error invalid-character-in-input
 33202                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 33203                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33204                                  swterr:
 33205 00002DA2 C3                      	retn
 33206                                  
 33207                                  getparm:
 33208 00002DA3 E865FF                  	call	check_switch
 33209 00002DA6 891E[F936]              	mov	[switches],bx		; save switches read so far
 33210 00002DAA 72F6                    	jc	short swterr
 33211                                  getnext:
 33212 00002DAC E876F9                  	call	getchr
 33213                                  	;jc	short done_line
 33214                                  	;jmp	short nextswtch
 33215                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33216 00002DAF 73E0                    	jnc	short nextswtch
 33217                                  ;swterr:
 33218                                  	;jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error
 33219                                  
 33220                                  done_line:
 33221                                  	; 12/12/2022

 33223                                  	;test	word [switches],flagdrive ; 8 ; see if drive specified

 33226                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 33227                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33228 00002DB9 C3                      	retn
 33229                                  
 33230                                  ;exitpl:
 33231                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33232                                  	; ds = cs
 33233                                  	;;pop	ds ; *
 33234                                  	;retn
 33235                                  
 33236                                  put_back:

 33238 00002DBE FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		; back up over linefeed
 33239 00002DC2 EBED                    	jmp	short done_line
 33240

 33245 00002DCD C706[F635]0000          	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES],0

 33260                                  ;
 33261                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 33262                                  ;
 33263                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 33264                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 33265                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 33266                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 33267                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 33268                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 33269                                  ;
 33270                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 33271                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 33272                                  ;
 33273                                  ;	note:  there is a routine by the same name in msdioctl.asm
 33274                                  ;
 33275                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33276                                  
 33277                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33278                                  
 33279                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 33280                                  setdeviceparameters:
 33281                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33282                                  	; ds = cs
 33283                                  	
 33284 00002DD3 06                      	push	es
 33285                                  
 33286 00002DD4 0E                      	push	cs
 33287 00002DD5 07                      	pop	es
 33288                                  
 33289 00002DD6 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 33290 00002DD8 8A1E[D135]              	mov	bl,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]
 33291 00002DDC 80FB00                  	cmp	bl,DEV_5INCH ; 0
 33292 00002DDF 7506                    	jne	short got_80
 33293

 33295                                  							; 48 tpi=40 cyl
 33296                                  got_80:

 33298 00002DE9 8BB7[7837]              	mov	si,[bpbtable+bx]	; get address of bpb
 33299                                  
 33300                                  	;mov	di,deviceparameters+7	
 33301                                  	; 02/11/2022

 33303 00002DF0 B91F00                  	mov	cx,A_BPB.size ; 31

 33305                                  	;repe	movsb

 33310                                  
 33311                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33312 00002DF7 F606[F936]20            	test	byte [switches],flagseclim ; 20h
 33313                                  	;test	word [switches],flagseclim ; 20h
 33314 00002DFC 7406                    	jz	short see_heads

 33324 00002E09 7406                    	jz	short heads_not_altered
 33325

 33328 00002E0E A3[E635]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax
 33329                                  
 33330                                  heads_not_altered:
 33331                                  
 33332                                  ; set up correct media descriptor byte and sectors/cluster
 33333                                  ;   sectors/cluster is always 2 except for any one sided disk or 1.44M
 33334                                  
 33335                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+9],2
 33336                                  	; 02/11/2022
 33337                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],2
 33338                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33339 00002E11 B80200                  	mov	ax,2	
 33340 00002E14 A2[D935]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 2
 33341                                  
 33342 00002E17 B3F0                    	mov	bl,0F0h			; get default mediabyte
 33343                                  
 33344                                  ;	preload the mediadescriptor from the bpb into bh for convenient access
 33345                                  
 33346                                  	;mov	bh,[deviceparameters+17]
 33347                                  	; 02/11/2022
 33348 00002E19 8A3E[E135]              	mov	bh,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 33349                                  
 33350                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33351                                  	; ax = 2
 33352 00002E1D 3906[E635]              	cmp	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax ; >2 heads?
 33353                                  	;cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],2 ; >2 heads?
 33354 00002E21 773C                    	ja	short got_correct_mediad ; just use default if heads>2
 33355                                  
 33356 00002E23 7524                    	jne	short only_one_head	; one head, do one head stuff
 33357                                  
 33358                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 33359                                  
 33360 00002E25 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 33361                                  
 33362                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 33363                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 33364                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 33365                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 33366                                  
 33367                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 33368                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 33369                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 33370                                  
 33371 00002E27 833E[E435]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 33372 00002E2C 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 33373 00002E2E 833E[D435]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 33374 00002E33 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 33375                                  
 33376                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 33377                                  
 33378 00002E35 EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 33379                                  
 33380                                  ;	check for 320K
 33381                                  
 33382                                  not_144m:
 33383 00002E37 833E[D435]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 33384 00002E3C 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 33385 00002E3E 833E[E435]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 33386 00002E43 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 33387                                  
 33388 00002E45 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh
 33389 00002E47 EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediad
 33390                                  
 33391                                  only_one_head:
 33392                                  
 33393                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 33394                                  
 33395 00002E49 803E[D135]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 33396 00002E4E 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 33397                                  
 33398                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 33399                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 33400                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 33401                                  
 33402 00002E50 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 33403 00002E52 833E[E435]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 33404                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33405 00002E57 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 33406                                  
 33407 00002E59 B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 33408                                  
 33409                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 33410                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 33411                                  
 33412                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 33413                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33414                                  	; ax = 2
 33415 00002E5B 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1
 33416 00002E5C A2[D935]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 1
 33417                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 33418                                  
 33419                                  got_correct_mediad:
 33420 00002E5F 881E[E135]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl
 33421                                  
 33422                                  ;	 Calculate the correct number of Total Sectors on medium
 33423                                  
 33424 00002E63 A1[D435]                	mov	ax,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 33425 00002E66 F726[E635]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS]
 33426 00002E6A F726[E435]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK]
 33427 00002E6E A3[DF35]                	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS],ax
 33428 00002E71 F8                      	clc				; we currently return no errors
 33429                                  
 33430 00002E72 C3                      	retn
 33431                                  
 33432                                  ;	M047 -- end rewritten routine

 33599                                  ;;   it screws up the direct comparisons below.

 33602                                  ;;endif

 33604                                  ;

 33607                                  ;;   There is no whitespace/delimiter between the "begin block" character

 33903                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33904                                  ;
 33905                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 33906                                  ;
 33907                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 33908                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 33909                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 33910                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 33911                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 33912                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 33913                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 33914                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 33915                                  ;
 33916                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33917                                  
 33918                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33919                                  
 33920                                  skip_comment:
 33921 00003039 E3EE                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 33922                                  
 33923                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33924                                  	; ds = cs	
 33925                                  
 33926 0000303B 803E[CC03]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 33927                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 33928 00003040 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 33929                                  
 33930 00003042 803E[CD03]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 33931                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 33932 00003047 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 33933                                  
 33934 00003049 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 33935                                  	
 33936 0000304C 3806[CE03]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 33937                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 33938 00003050 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 33939                                  
 33940 00003052 803E[CD03]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 33941                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 33942 00003057 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 33943                                  
 33944 00003059 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 33945                                  	
 33946 0000305D 3806[CF03]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 33947                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 33948 00003061 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 33949                                  skip_cmmt:
 33950 00003063 E3C4                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 33951 00003065 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 33952 00003068 46                      	inc	si
 33953 00003069 49                      	dec	cx
 33954 0000306A 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 33955 0000306C 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 33956                                  no_commt:
 33957 0000306E C3                      	retn
 33958                                  
 33959                                  ; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33960                                  %if 0
 33961                                  
 33962                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 33963                                  
 33964                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33965                                  ;
 33966                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 33967                                  ;
 33968                                  ;   INPUT
 33969                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 33970                                  ;
 33971                                  ;   OUTPUT
 33972                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 33973                                  ;
 33974                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 33975                                  ;       All
 33976                                  ;
 33977                                  ;   HISTORY
 33978                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 33979                                  ;
 33980                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33981                                  
 33982                                  kbd_read:
 33983                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 33984                                          jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 33985                                  
 33986                                          push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 33987                                          sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 33988                                          mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 33989                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 33990                                  kbd_loop:
 33991                                          mov     ah,1            ;
 33992                                          int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 33993                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 33994                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 33995                                          int     16h             ;
 33996                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 33997                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 33998                                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 33999                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 34000                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34001                                  	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 34002                                  
 34003                                  	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?
 34004                                          jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 34005                                  kbd_loopdone:
 34006                                          pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 34007                                  kbd_nodelay:
 34008                                          sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 34009                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 34010                                          int     16h             ;
 34011                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 34012                                          jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 34013                                          inc     bx              ; yes
 34014                                          inc     bx
 34015                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 34016                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 34017                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 34018                                          mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 34019                                          int     16h             ;
 34020                                          jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 34021                                          or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 34022                                          jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 34023                                  
 34024                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 34025                                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 34026                                          je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 34027                                  	
 34028                                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 34029                                          jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 34030                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 34031                                          mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 34032                                          call    print
 34033                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 34034                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4           ;
 34035                                          jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 34036                                  kbd_notf5:
 34037                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 34038                                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 34039                                          je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 34040                                  
 34041                                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 34042                                          jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 34043                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 34044                                          mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 34045                                          call    print           ;
 34046                                          mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 34047                                          mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 34048                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 34049                                          mov     ah,0            ;
 34050                                          int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 34051                                          mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 34052                                          or      bx,bx           ;
 34053                                          jz	short kbd_clean	;
 34054                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 34055                                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 34056                                          jb	short kbd_exit	;
 34057                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 34058                                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 34059                                          stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 34060                                          retn			;
 34061                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 34062                                          clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 34063                                          retn			;
 34064                                  
 34065                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34066                                  ;
 34067                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 34068                                  ;
 34069                                  ;   INPUT
 34070                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 34071                                  ;
 34072                                  ;   OUTPUT
 34073                                  ;       None
 34074                                  ;
 34075                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 34076                                  ;       None
 34077                                  ;
 34078                                  ;   HISTORY
 34079                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 34080                                  ;
 34081                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34082                                  
 34083                                  set_numlock:
 34084                                          push    ax
 34085                                          push    ds
 34086                                          sub     ax,ax
 34087                                          mov     ds,ax
 34088                                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 34089                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 34090                                          jne	short not_off	; no
 34091                                          and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 34092                                          jmp     short set_done
 34093                                  not_off:
 34094                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 34095                                          stc
 34096                                          jne	short set_done	; no
 34097                                          or      byte [0417h],20h
 34098                                  set_done:
 34099                                          pop     ds
 34100                                          pop     ax
 34101                                          retn
 34102                                  
 34103                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34104                                  
 34105                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34106                                  ;
 34107                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 34108                                  ;
 34109                                  ;   INPUT
 34110                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 34111                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 34112                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 34113                                  ;
 34114                                  ;   OUTPUT
 34115                                  ;       Same as above;  the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 34116                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 34117                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 34118                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 34119                                  ;
 34120                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 34121                                  ;       All
 34122                                  ;
 34123                                  ;   NOTES
 34124                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 34125                                  ;
 34126                                  ;   HISTORY
 34127                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 34128                                  ;
 34129                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34130                                  
 34131                                  menu_check:
 34132                                  
 34133                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present;  if so, then
 34134                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 34135                                  
 34136                                          push    cx              ;
 34137                                          push    si              ;
 34138                                          sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 34139                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 34140                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 34141                                          jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 34142                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 34143                                          jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 34144                                          inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 34145                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 34146                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 34147                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 34148                                          jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 34149                                          or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 34150                                          jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 34151                                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 34152                                          mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 34153                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 34154                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 34155                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 34156                                          jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 34157                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 34158                                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 34159                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 34160                                          cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 34161                                          je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 34162                                          cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 34163                                          jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 34164                                          call    get_char        ;
 34165                                          and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 34166                                          cmp     al,[swit_n+1]
 34167                                          jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 34168                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 34169                                          jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 34170                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 34171                                          cmp     al,[swit_f+1]
 34172                                          jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 34173                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 34174                                          jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 34175                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 34176                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 34177                                          jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 34178                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 34179                                          pop     si              ;
 34180                                          pop     cx              ;
 34181                                  
 34182                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 34183                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 34184                                  
 34185                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 34186                                          jnz	short menu_search
 34187                                  ;
 34188                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 34189                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 34190                                  ;
 34191                                          call    kbd_read
 34192                                          jnc	short menu_search
 34193                                          jmp	menu_abort
 34194                                  
 34195                                  ;   Search for MENU block;  it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 34196                                  
 34197                                  menu_search:
 34198                                          sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 34199                                          mov     di,szMenu	;
 34200                                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 34201                                          jnc	short menu_found ;
 34202                                          mov     byte [szBoot],0
 34203                                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 34204                                  
 34205                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 34206                                  
 34207                                  menu_color:
 34208                                          push    cx              ;
 34209                                          push    dx              ;
 34210                                          mov     dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 34211                                          call    get_number	; get first number
 34212                                          and     bl,0Fh		; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 34213                                          mov     ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 34214                                          and     dl,0F0h         ;
 34215                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 34216                                          call    delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 34217                                          jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 34218                                          call    get_number	; get next number
 34219                                          and     bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 34220                                          mov     dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 34221                                          and     dl,0Fh		;
 34222                                          mov     cl,4            ;
 34223                                          shl     bl,cl           ;
 34224                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 34225                                  check_color:                    ;
 34226                                          cmp     ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 34227                                          jne	short set_color	; no
 34228                                          xor     dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 34229                                  set_color:
 34230                                          mov     [bMenuColor],dl ;
 34231                                          pop     dx              ;
 34232                                          pop     cx              ;
 34233                                          jmp	menu_nextitem
 34234                                  
 34235                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 34236                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 34237                                  
 34238                                  menu_found:
 34239                                          mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 34240                                          mov     word [offDefBlock],0
 34241                                          mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 34242                                          and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 34243                                  
 34244                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 34245                                          sub     dx,dx           ; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 34246                                  
 34247                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 34248                                  
 34249                                  menu_process:
 34250                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 34251                                          jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 34252                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 34253                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 34254                                          je	short to_menu_getdefault
 34255                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 34256                                          je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 34257                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 34258                                          je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 34259                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 34260                                          je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 34261                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 34262                                          je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 34263                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 34264                                          je	short menu_numlock ;
 34265                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 34266                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 34267                                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 34268                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 34269                                          stc                     ;
 34270                                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 34271                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 34272                                  menu_numlock:
 34273                                          call    set_numlock
 34274                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 34275                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 34276                                          jmp     short menu_getdefault
 34277                                  
 34278                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 34279                                  
 34280                                  menu_default:
 34281                                          mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 34282                                          cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 34283                                          jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 34284                                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 34285                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 34286                                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 34287                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 34288                                          mov     si,bx           ;
 34289                                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 34290                                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 34291                                          jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 34292                                          mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 34293                                  timeout_ok:                     ;
 34294                                          mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 34295                                  timeout_skip:
 34296                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 34297                                  
 34298                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 34299                                  
 34300                                  menu_item:
 34301                                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 34302                                          jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 34303                                          mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 34304                                          call    srch_block      ;
 34305                                          je	short menu_itemfound ;
 34306                                          stc                     ;
 34307                                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 34308                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 34309                                  
 34310                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 34311                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 34312                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 34313                                  
 34314                                  menu_itemfound:
 34315                                          inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 34316                                          mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 34317                                          mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 34318                                          add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 34319                                  
 34320                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 34321                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 34322                                  ;   description...
 34323                                  
 34324                                          mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 34325                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 34326                                          mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 34327                                          call    skip_token      ;
 34328                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 34329                                          call    skip_delim      ;
 34330                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 34331                                          xchg    bx,di           ;
 34332                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 34333                                  
 34334                                  menu_nextitem:
 34335                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 34336                                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 34337                                  
 34338                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 34339                                  
 34340                                  menu_getdefault:
 34341                                          or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 34342                                          jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 34343                                          sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 34344                                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 34345                                  menu_valid:
 34346                                          sub     bx,bx           ;
 34347                                          mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 34348                                          mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 34349                                          or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 34350                                          jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 34351                                          inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 34352                                  menu_chkdefault:
 34353                                          push    bx              ;
 34354                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 34355                                          mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 34356                                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 34357                                          push    ds              ;
 34358                                          push    es              ;
 34359                                          pop     ds              ;
 34360                                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 34361                                          pop     ds              ;
 34362                                          pop     bx              ;
 34363                                          je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 34364                                          inc     bx              ;
 34365                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 34366                                          jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 34367                                  menu_nodefault:
 34368                                          mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 34369                                  menu_setdefault:
 34370                                          mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 34371                                  
 34372                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 34373                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 34374                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 34375                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 34376                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 34377                                  ;   with no timeout)
 34378                                  
 34379                                          cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 34380                                          jne	short menu_display ; no
 34381                                          test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 34382                                          jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 34383                                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 34384                                  
 34385                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 34386                                  
 34387                                  menu_display:
 34388                                          mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 34389                                          int     10h             ;
 34390                                          mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 34391                                          int     10h             ;
 34392                                          push    es              ;
 34393                                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 34394                                          mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 34395                                          mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 34396                                          mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 34397                                          mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 34398                                          mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 34399                                          mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 34400                                          int     10h             ;
 34401                                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 34402                                          mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 34403                                          sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 34404                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 34405                                          mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 34406                                  	dec     dl              ;
 34407                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 34408                                          mov	dh,[es:84h]
 34409                                  	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 34410                                          jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 34411                                          mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 34412                                  menu_clear:
 34413                                          int     10h             ; clear the screen using the req. attribute
 34414                                          pop     es              ;
 34415                                          mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 34416                                          mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 34417                                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 34418                                  
 34419                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 34420                                          jnz     short menu_nostatus
 34421                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 34422                                          mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; restore DH
 34423                                          mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 34424                                          mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 34425                                          int     10h             ;
 34426                                          mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 34427                                          call    print           ;
 34428                                          mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 34429                                          int     10h             ;
 34430                                          sub     dl,2            ;
 34431                                          mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 34432                                  
 34433                                  menu_nostatus:
 34434                                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 34435                                  menu_disploop:
 34436                                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 34437                                          inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"?  because it's a 1-byte opcode
 34438                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 34439                                          jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 34440                                  
 34441                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 34442                                  
 34443                                          mov     dl,0            ; select column
 34444                                          mov     dh,bl           ;
 34445                                          add     dh,4            ; select row below menu
 34446                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 34447                                          mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position beneath the block list
 34448                                          int     10h             ;
 34449                                  
 34450                                          mov     dx,_$MenuPrmpt
 34451                                          call    print           ;
 34452                                          call    select_item     ; make a selection, return # in BX
 34453                                          mov     dx,crlfm	
 34454                                          call    print           ;
 34455                                          push    word [bDisableUI]
 34456                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 34457                                          call    show_status     ; clear the status line now
 34458                                          pop     word [bDisableUI]
 34459
